review_title: Overall a good place to worj
pros: Great team members and evolving facility
cons: High nursing turnover, lacks technology for competitiveness

review_title: Not a bad place to work but mis-managed
pros: up to date hospital, family friendly, easy schedule, fun staff
cons: irresponsible spending by hospital management, lots of needless waste, management doesn't hold professional staff accountable, poor / rare training opportunities, high turnover, below industry standard pay. (there's currently 2 technicians making the same exact salary- one has 20 years electro-mechanical experience, a decade in the field servicing hospital equipment, military & college educated , the other is 24 yo with computer science knowledge. the latter may be worth the salary, but the former is grossly underpaid.

review_title: An honest review from an employee of over 15 years.
pros: Self gratification from doing a job well done.   Fair salary. Solid company. Diversity in job - can change areas of work and shift if desired.  Can utilize other staff for decision making and expertise and to learn.
cons: It's a big company with many levels of organization where many employees that don't work full-time are not noticed.  JACHO standards freak them out and is not worth, at least to the employee, all that they have to go through to stay approved.  Many senior staff 'eat their young' which is really hard to watch happen.  Some senior management positions have been vacated and left unfilled creating more work and hardship on their team.

pros: The people that work here are great. The company culture and employee engagement has improved over the last few years which is due to some nice effort on the part of current leadership.
cons: The pay is MUCH LESS than facilities in the surrounding region. They are going to have a terrible time recruiting and retaining talent in the coming years as those that have been here forever start retiring. While improvement has been made in the general culture over the last few years, there's much work still to be done, especially on the part of the upper management

review_title: Poor place to work, worse place to get treated.
pros: If you live locally it is the only place to work without traveling some distance.
cons: Management no longer cares about the outcome of the patients or how they treat their staff. Patients frequently miss required meds and care because there isn't enough staff to care for them. Critical patients have to wait excessive amounts of time for the same reason.

review_title: Used to be a good place to work
pros: Ive work for Cheshire Medical for over 10 years when I started it was a great place to work. Over the years it has lost its vision for caring for its patients and employees and is more focused on politics.
cons:
Benefits get worse every year
Pay raises maybe every 3 years
Constant layoffs

pros: Co workers are great group of people. Hours are good.
cons: Pay sucks. Administration spend more time in "meetings" having a catered lunch then actually doing anything useful or helpful.

review_title: Not very well organized, poor leadership.
pros: There were no pros to working here.  Very reactive environment instead of proactive.  Top heavy in administrative positions leading to over analysis of issues but no solid action plan to solve them.
cons: Disorganized leadership.  Tendency to hire people and their family members to get them to take the position disregarding any reviews of the family member's  lack of qualifications for the position.
